alert.note: Alert for Conway; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Van Buren County Higher Elevations; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 10:44AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Logan, southwestern Searcy, southeastern Johnson, western Van Buren, northwestern Conway, northern Yell and Pope Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1044 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Moore to Mount Magazine. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Clinton... Dardanelle... Atkins... Pottsville... Lamar... Dover... London... Knoxville... Hector... Blue Mountain... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Happy Bend... Dabney... Jerusalem... Midway in Logan County... Mosley... Taral... Carden Bottoms... Cleveland... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
